member.name: T:Desharp.HiddenAttribute
member.summary: Add hidden attribute to hide any property or field in your class to print it by Desharp.Debug.Dump() or Desharp.Debug.Log() methods. To print always everything, add to your (App|Web).config: <add key="Desharp:DumpCompillerGenerated" value="true" />

member.name: T:Desharp.Completers.Detector
member.summary: Detecting class to check value types to dump them correctly, always internaly used by Desharp, but it should be used for any general purposes.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsTypeObject(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is Type object.
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsPrimitiveType(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is sbyte | byte | short | ushort | int | uint | long | ulong | float | double | decimal | char | bool | string | object.
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsReflectionObject(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is MethodInfo | PropertyInfo | FieldInfo | EventInfo | MemberInfo | ConstructorInfo.
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsReflectionObjectArray(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is MethodInfo[] | PropertyInfo[] | FieldInfo[] | EventInfo[] | MemberInfo[] | ConstructorInfo[].
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsArray(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is sbyte[] | byte[] | short[] | ushort[] | int[] | uint[] | long[] | ulong[] | float[] | double[] | decimal[] | char[] | bool[] | string[] | object[].
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsEnum(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is enum.
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsDbResult(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is DataSet | DataTable | DataRow.
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsEnumerable(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is implementing IList | System.Array | System.Collections.ArrayList | System.Data.Common.DbDataReader.
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsCollection(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is ICollection.
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsDictionary(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is IDictionary and it has properties Count, Keys and Values.
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: M:Desharp.Completers.Detector.IsNameValueCollection(System.Object)
member.summary: True if value is NameValueCollection.
member.param: Any value or null.

member.name: T:Desharp.Core.Tools
member.summary: Usefull static functions used by Desharp assembly internaly, but it should be used for any general purposes.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.GetClientIpAddress
member.summary: Return client request IP address, in IPv4 or in IPv6 format, depends on client.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.IsAssemblyBuildAsDebug(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Returns true if called assembly is builded as Debug release.
member.param: Assembly to check for build mode.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.GetWindowsEntryAssembly
member.summary: Get desktop application entry assembly written by developer, no .NET framework system assembly.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.GetWebEntryAssembly
member.summary: Get web application hosted in IIS server entry assembly written by developer, no .NET framework system assembly.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.GetRequestId
member.summary: Get web request id, by HttpContext.Current.Timestamp.Ticks;

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.GetProcessId
member.summary: Get system process id, standardly displayed integer in Task manager.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.GetThreadId
member.summary: Get .NET thread id of current process thread.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.JavascriptString(System.String)
member.summary: Convert any sstring or HTML into safe javascript string value representation.
member.param: Any string to escape for safe javascript string.
member.returns: Safe javascript string.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.HtmlEntities(System.String)
member.summary: Convert any string into HTML entities where necessary.
member.param: Any string value to process.
member.returns: Safe HTML string.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.Md5(System.String)
member.summary: Create MD5 hash from any string value.
member.param: String value to hash.

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.IsWindows
member.summary: Determinate if platform is windows OS - PlatformID.Win32NT | Win32S | Win32Windows | WinCE;

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.GetTypeGlobaly(System.String)
member.summary: Return Type object by string in forms: "Full.Class.Name" or "AssemblyName:Full.Class.Name", desired type should be in any loaded assembly in memory, not just in current assembly.
member.param: "Full.Class.Name" or "AssemblyName:Full.Class.Name"
member.returns: Desired type

member.name: M:Desharp.Core.Tools.GetTypeGlobaly(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return Type object by two strings in form: "AssemblyName", "Full.Class.Name", desired type should be in any loaded assembly in memory, not just in current assembly.
member.param: "AssemblyName" for AssemblyName.dll
Full class name including namespace
member.returns: Desired type

member.name: T:Desharp.FireDumpType
member.summary: Fire dumper message type to choose in client browser propert console method lie console.log(), console.debug(). console.trace() exc...

member.summary: Print value in browser console by: console.debug();

member.name: F:Desharp.FireDumpType.Log
member.summary: Print value in browser console by: console.log();

member.name: F:Desharp.FireDumpType.Trace
member.summary: Print value in browser console by: console.trace();

member.name: F:Desharp.FireDumpType.Info
member.summary: Print value in browser console by: console.trace();

member.name: F:Desharp.FireDumpType.Warn
member.summary: Print value in browser console by: console.warn();

member.name: F:Desharp.FireDumpType.Error
member.summary: Print value in browser console by: console.error();

member.summary: Print value in browser console by: console.table();

member.name: T:Desharp.PanelIconType
member.summary: Panel icon type for custom web debug panel.

member.name: F:Desharp.PanelIconType.None
member.summary: Debug panels without icon.

member.name: F:Desharp.PanelIconType.Class
member.summary: For panel icons defined in internal Desharp response css code.

member.name: F:Desharp.PanelIconType.Code
member.summary: For panel icons defined in custom class as HTML code.

member.name: T:Desharp.PanelType
member.summary: Desharp web panel type.

member.name: F:Desharp.PanelType.BarText
member.summary: Web debug panel with text context, in bar, no window, no actions on mouse over or click.

member.name: F:Desharp.PanelType.BarBtnWithJsHandler
member.summary: Web debug panel with js handler, you can specify any js function call in panel content.

member.name: F:Desharp.PanelType.BarBtnAndWindow
member.summary: Web debug panel with floating window with custom HTML content, used for most cases.

member.name: F:Desharp.PanelType.BarBtnAndScreen
member.summary: Web debug panel with rendered content showed on whole browser screen, used for exceptions panel.

member.name: T:Desharp.Module
member.summary: ASP.NET Http module to dispatch Desharp separately from original application.

member.name: P:Desharp.Module.ModuleName
member.summary: Unique module name

member.name: M:Desharp.Module.#ctor
member.summary: Empty constructor - required by IHttpModule interface

member.name: M:Desharp.Module.Dispose
member.summary: Empty method Dispose - required by IHttpModule interface

member.name: M:Desharp.Module.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: Application request events initialization - BeginRequest, AcquireRequestState, PostRequestHandlerExecute, PreSendRequestHeaders, EndRequest, Error and Disposed
member.param: ASP.NET aplication instance.

member.name: T:Desharp.DumpOptions
member.summary: Dump options for Desharp.Debug.Dump() calls to optimize how values or exceptions should be rendered or how to work with rendered results.

member.name: F:Desharp.DumpOptions.Depth
member.summary: How many levels in complex type variables will be iterated throw to dump all it's properties, fields and other values.

member.name: F:Desharp.DumpOptions.MaxLength
member.summary: If any dumped string length is larger than this value, it will be cutted into this max length.

member.name: F:Desharp.DumpOptions.Return
member.summary: Set true if you want to return dumped string as result of Desharp.Debug.Dump() function call.

member.name: T:Desharp.Debug
member.summary:
Desharp main class:
Dump any object/exception to application output.
Store any dumped object/exception in text/html log files.
Enable/disable objects dumping to output.
Configure desharp from running application environment.

member.name: F:Desharp.Debug.Version
member.summary: Desharp assembly Version.

member.name: P:Desharp.Debug.Fire
member.summary: Get or set current request FireDump to log anything into client browser console window through FirePHP extension.

member.name: F:Desharp.Debug.SESSION_STORAGE_KEY
member.summary: Session storrage key to store Desharp data inside Web app session storrage.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Enabled(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Enable or disable variables dumping from application code environment for all threads.
member.param: true to enable, false to disable, if no param defined, no changes will be made.
member.returns: bool about enabled/disabled dumping state
member.example:
To determinate if dumps printing to output is enabled or not: bool dumpsPrintedToOtuput = Desharp.Debug.Enabled(); To enable/disable dumps printing to output:
Desharp.Debug.Enabled(true); // to enable dumps print in output Desharp.Debug.Enabled(false); // to disable dumps print in output

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Configure(Desharp.DebugConfig)
member.summary: Configure Desharp assembly from running application environment and override any XML config settings or automaticly detected settings.
member.param: Specialized Desharp configuration collection - just create new instance with public fields of that.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.GetLastError
member.summary: Return last uncatched Exception in request, mostly used in web applications by error page rendering process to know something about Exception before.
member.returns: Last Exception instance, including original exception callstack and possible inner exceptions.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.GetProcessingTime
member.summary: Return spended request processing time for web applications or return application up time for all other platforms.
member.returns: Returned values is number of seconds with 3 decimal places after comma with miliseconds.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Timer(System.String,System.Boolean,Desharp.Level)
member.summary:
Prints to ouput or into log file number of seconds from last timer call under called name in seconds with 3 floating point decimal spaces.
If no name specified or name is empty string, there is returned:
Web applications - number of seconds from request beggining.
Desktop applications - number of seconds from application start.
member.param: Timer name, used as key to find last Desharp.Debug.Timer(name); call from internal dictionary to print the timespan in app output or log file.
If true, do not print or log timer value - only return the time span difference decimal value as result of this function.
Use log level to specify log file used when dump printing into output is disabled, "debug.log" used by default.
member.returns: If returnTimerSeconds param is true, return the time span difference decimal from the last Desharp.Debug.Timer(name); call under called name or return zero if returnTimerSeconds param is false (by default).

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Assert(System.Boolean,System.String,Desharp.Level)
member.summary: Print to application output or log into file (if enabled) first param to be true or not and describe what was equal or not in first param by second param message.
member.param: Comparation boolean to dump or log, way to compare things is up to you, you need to process it in method param space to send here boolean only.
Any text to describe previous comparation.
Log level, used only when printing to output is disabled, "default.log" used by default.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Stop
member.summary: Print current thread stack trace into application output and exit running application. - web applications - stop current request - any other applications - stop application with all it's threads

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Dump(System.Exception,System.Nullable{Desharp.DumpOptions})
member.summary:
Dump exception instance to application output if output dumping is enabled. It renders:
exception type
exception message
if exception has been catched or not catched
exception hash id
error file where exception has been thrown
thread callstack
all inner exceptions after this exception in the same way
member.param: Exception instance to dump.

Dump options collection (optional) - just create new instance with public fields of that:
For this dump call you can change options:
Return (bool, optional) - if exception will be dumped into application output (as default) or returned as dumped string value.
member.returns: Returns empty string if debug printing is disabled and also returns empty string if second param DumpOptions.Return is false (by default), but if true, return dumped exception as string.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Dump(System.Object[])
member.summary: Dump any values to application output (in web applications into debug bar, in desktop applications into console).
member.param: Infinite number of values to dump into application output.
member.returns: All dumped values are in this function version always returned as dumped string.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Dump(System.Object,System.Nullable{Desharp.DumpOptions})
member.summary: Dump any type value to application output (in web applications into debug bar, in desktop applications into console).
member.param: Any type value to dump into application output.

Dump options collection (optional) - just create new instance with public fields of that:
For this dump call you can change options:
Depth (int, optional) - how many levels in complex type variables will be iterated throw to dump all it's properties, fields and other values.
MaxLength (int, optional) - if any dumped string length is larger than this value, it will be cutted into this max. length.
Return (bool, optional)- if value will be dumped into application output (as default) or returned as dumped string value.
member.returns: Returns empty string by default or dumped variable string if you specify in second argument DumpOptions.Return to be true.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.DumpAndDie(System.Object,System.Nullable{Desharp.DumpOptions})
member.summary: Dump any type value to direct application output (not into web request debug bar in web applications!) and stop request/thread (in web applications dump into direct response body, in desktop applications into console).
member.param: Any type value to dump into application output.

Dump options collection (optional) - just create new instance with public fields of that:
For this dump call you can change options:
Depth (int, optional) - how many levels in complex type variables will be iterated throw to dump all it's properties, fields and other values.
MaxLength (int, optional) - if any dumped string length is larger than this value, it will be cutted into this max. length.
Return (bool, optional)- if value will be dumped into application output (as default) or returned as dumped string value.
member.returns: Returns empty string by default or dumped variable string if you specify in second argument DumpOptions.Return to be true.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Log(System.Exception)
member.summary:
Log exception instance as dumped string into exceptions.log|exceptions.html file. It stores:
exception type
exception message
if exception has been catched or not catched
exception hash id
error file where exception has been thrown
thread callstack
all inner exceptions after this exception in the same way
member.param: Exception instance to print.

member.name: M:Desharp.Debug.Log(System.Object,Desharp.Level,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Log any type value to application *.log|*.html file, specified by level param.
member.param: Any type value to dump into application output.
Log level to specify log file name and also to allow/prevent write dumped variable into proper log file by config settings.
How many levels in complex type variables will be iterated throw to dump all it's properties, fields and other values.
If any dumped string length is larger than this value, it will be cutted into this max. length.
member.returns: Returns empty string by default or dumped variable string if you specify in second argument DumpOptions.Return to true.

member.name: T:Desharp.EnvType
member.summary: Application general environment - should be only defined as web or desktop.

member.name: F:Desharp.EnvType.Auto
member.summary: Environment will be defined by Desharp assembly at first Desharp call.

member.name: F:Desharp.EnvType.Windows
member.summary: Environment for desktop applications - WPF, Winforms, console apps and other - generaly not web.

member.name: F:Desharp.EnvType.Web
member.summary: Environment for web applications hosted in IIS server.

member.name: T:Desharp.Level
member.summary: Application logging levels to define log filename used for Desharp.Debug.Log() calls and to define if log message will be written or not by config settings.

member.name: F:Desharp.Level.DEBUG
member.summary: debug.log|debug.html, mostly used as default log file.

member.name: F:Desharp.Level.INFO
member.summary: info.log|info.html

member.name: F:Desharp.Level.NOTICE
member.summary: notice.log|notice.html

member.name: F:Desharp.Level.WARNING
member.summary: warning.log|warning.html

member.name: F:Desharp.Level.ERROR
member.summary: error.log|error.html

member.name: F:Desharp.Level.CRITICAL
member.summary: critical.log|critical.html

member.name: F:Desharp.Level.ALERT
member.summary: alert.log|alert.html

member.name: F:Desharp.Level.EMERGENCY
member.summary: emergency.log|emergency.html

member.name: F:Desharp.Level.JAVASCRIPT
member.summary: javascript.log|javascript.html, usually used to store javascript errors from client's browser by window.onerror() global handler.

member.name: T:Desharp.LogFormat
member.summary: Specify log files format - should be only text or html.

member.name: F:Desharp.LogFormat.Auto
member.summary: Log format will be determinated automaticly at first Desharp assembly use.

member.name: F:Desharp.LogFormat.Html
member.summary: All log messages will be written in HTML into *.html file

member.name: F:Desharp.LogFormat.Text
member.summary: All log messages will be written in TEXT into *.log file

member.name: T:Desharp.Panels.Abstract
member.summary: Web debug bar panel base class.

member.name: P:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.Name
member.summary: Unique bar panel name, required.

member.name: P:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.AddIfEmpty
member.summary: If true, panel will be displayed also in cases when it's content is empty string, false to not display the panel if empty string, false by default.

member.name: P:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.DefaultWindowSizes
member.summary: Default window sizes when panel floating window is displayed at first time, 300x200 by default.

member.name: P:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.PanelType
member.summary: Panel type, behaviour. You can specify various types, bar panel with custom resizeable floating window defined with custom content by default.

member.name: P:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.PanelIconType
member.summary: Panel icon type, should by "css class" for internal desharp panels or "code" for panels defined icon in IconValue property as HTML code with base64 encoded image in tag.

member.name: P:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.IconValue
member.summary: Icon value, should be css class for internal Desharp panels or HTML code icon value as tag with base64 encoded icon image.

member.name: M:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor, nothing special, just point for you to start any custom code every request.

member.name: M:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.SessionBegin
member.summary: Called at session begin request event, called before Controller/action execution.

member.name: M:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.SessionEnd
member.summary: Called at session end request event, called after Controller/action execution.

member.name: M:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.RenderBarText
member.summary: Render text content for web bar button.
member.returns: Text content for web bar button

member.name: M:Desharp.Panels.Abstract.RenderWindowContent
member.summary: Render any string content for bar floating window, if content will be empty string, bar panel wil not be rendered by default.
member.returns: Bar panel floating window content.

member.name: T:Desharp.Renderers.Dumper
member.summary: Reflection class to dump any type value into string representation by Desharp.Renderers.Dumper.Dump(value);

member.name: M:Desharp.Renderers.Dumper.Dump(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Dump any type value into string representation and returns itg, this is direct dumper, no Desharp configuration will be used to process this dump.
member.param: Any type value to dump into string
True to dump values as HTML, false to dump as TEXT.
How many levels at maximum in complex type variables will be iterated throw to dump all it's properties, fields and other values.
If any dumped string length is larger than this value, it will be cutted into this max length.
member.returns: Returns HTML or TEXT representation of any called value.

member.name: T:Desharp.DebugConfig
member.summary: Desharp configuration collection for Desharp.Debug.Configure(); calls.

member.name: F:Desharp.DebugConfig.Depth
member.summary: How many levels in complex type variables will be iterated throw to dump all it's properties, fields and other values.

member.name: F:Desharp.DebugConfig.Enabled
member.summary: Dumped objects printing to output enabled/disabled.

member.name: F:Desharp.DebugConfig.Directory
member.summary: Relative or absolute path into directory where all log files and mail notify boolean files will be stored.

member.name: F:Desharp.DebugConfig.ErrorPage
member.summary: Custom static error page file to send as web application response if any not catched exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:Desharp.DebugConfig.LogWriteMilisecond
member.summary: Miliseconds for interval to write Desharp.Debug.Log(); results from RAM into HDD to optimize application performance.

member.name: F:Desharp.DebugConfig.LogFormat
member.summary: Application logs content format, should be HTML or TEXT.

member.name: F:Desharp.DebugConfig.EnvType
member.summary: Application environment - usually automaticly determinated by Desharp asembly - change this value only when you REALLY know what you are doing!

member.name: F:Desharp.DebugConfig.Panels
member.summary: Custom web debug panel types, implementing Desharp.Panels.Abstract to create their instances for each web request where debuging enabled.

member.name: T:Desharp.FireDump
member.summary: AJAX debug utility for original FirePHP browser extension
member.remarks:
Original PHP libraries:
www.firephp.org
github.com/firephp/firephp-core
code.google.com/p/firephp
Browser plugins:
Firefox - FirePHP plugin
Chrome - FirePHP4Chrome plugin
Special thanks to xuzhibin to inspire me to rewite FirePHP again into C#.
Current API designed by Tom Flidr <tomflidr@gmail.com>

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.DumpCallStackInfo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configure all FireDump calls for current request to display source code place in browser console, where these FireDump calls have been called.
member.param: Set true to display sources places, where FireDump calls has been used, false otherwise.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.Log(System.Object)
member.summary: Display value in browser console by classic console.log(obj); call.
member.param: Any value to serialize with (new JavascriptSerializer()).Serialize(obj); and to display in client browser console.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.Debug(System.Object)
member.summary: Display value in browser console by console.debug(obj); call. This console item is rendered as blue text only if value is only a text message, if value is structuralized value, it's displayed in classic way.
member.param: Any value to serialize with (new JavascriptSerializer()).Serialize(obj); and to display in client browser console.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.Trace(System.Object)
member.summary: Display value in browser console by console.trace(obj); call.
member.param: Any value to serialize with (new JavascriptSerializer()).Serialize(obj); and to display in client browser console.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.Info(System.Object)
member.summary: Display value in browser console by console.info(obj); call.
member.param: Any value to serialize with (new JavascriptSerializer()).Serialize(obj); and to display in client browser console.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.Warn(System.Object)
member.summary: Display value in browser console by console.warn(obj); call. This console item is rendered as black text with light orange background and with orange icon with exclamation mark inside.
member.param: Any value to serialize with (new JavascriptSerializer()).Serialize(obj); and to display in client browser console.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.Error(System.Object)
member.summary: Display value in browser console by console.error(obj); call. This console item is rendered as red text with light red background and with red icon with cross inside.
member.param: Any value to serialize with (new JavascriptSerializer()).Serialize(obj); and to display in client browser console.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.Dump(System.Object,Desharp.FireDumpType)
member.summary: Display value in browser console by console.[log|info|debug|trace|warn|error|table](obj); call.
member.param: Any value to serialize with (new JavascriptSerializer()).Serialize(obj); and to display in client browser console.
Javascript browser console object function name to call on client, but in upper case.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.Exception(System.Exception)
member.summary: Display .NET Exception in browser console by console.error(obj); call. This console item is rendered as red text with light red background and with red icon with cross inside.
member.param: .NET Exception to display in client browser console.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.

member.name: M:Desharp.FireDump.Table(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Display value in browser console by console.table(obj); call. This console item is rendered as table with variable count of columns and rows - it depends by value.
member.param: Table heading text.

Any structuralized value to serialize with (new JavascriptSerializer()).Serialize(obj); and to display in client browser console. Basicly it shoud by .NET Array with Arrays, but it should by any .NET IList, ICollection, IEnumerable, IDictionary, anything for foreach or for cycle in two levels.
member.returns: FireDump instance is returned to call any other FireDump method in call chain.
